<RESUME_START>
PROJECT MANAGER/CAD DESIGNER

EXPERIENCE


05/2015 to Current
Project Manager/CAD Designer
Company Name
Oversee and manage all commercial and residential iron railing, security door, gate, and window well cover projects.
Interact with customers (templating, timeframes, provide design ideas and solutions, etc.).
Coordinate installs with in-house installers as well as other contractors.
Draft custom hand rails, stair rails, gates, doors along with any other miscellaneous projects using Sketchup Pro.
Provide the shop with detailed blueprints, cut lists, and install sheets Answer fabrication questions.

06/2014 to 05/2015
Welder/Fabricator
Company Name
Make templates for custom handrails.
Fabrication and installation of commercial and residential stair railings, deck railings and balusters.
On-site welding and fabrication.

05/2012 to 09/2012
Strip vehicles
Company Name
Strip upholstery (seats, floors, convertible tops, and headliners). Repaired seat foam, chrome, and leather
Address Pro, Shipping Company.

01/2010 to 10/2014
Miscellaneous inserting, packaging, and hand work.

EDUCATION

Grandview High School
— City , State
May 2015
Pickens Technical College
— City , State

CERTIFICATIONS

Safety in welding
*Oxy-acetylene welding and cutting
*Plasma torch cutting
*Blueprint and welding symbol reading
*Positions 1-4 GMAW, FCAW, SMAW with and without backing
*Knowledge of destructive and non-destructive testing
*Entry level Aluminum GTAW and carbon GTAW
*2014 and 2015 SKILLS USA competition
*Basic/SMAW/Semi-Automatic Welding Certificate
*Basic/SMAW/Semi-Automatic/AWS Entry Level Welder Certificate
*Basic/Entry/Advanced Welder Certificate
*Advanced Welder Certificate
*AWS Entry-Level Welder Certificate
*SMAW Structural Welding Certificate
*Semi-Automatic Welding Certificate

INTERESTS

Mechanical Engineering and Design
*3D Printing and all Computer-aided manufacturing processes

SKILLS

3D, Basic, Blueprint, blueprints, designing, doors, Layout, window, Multi — tasking , packaging, quick learner, reading, Safety, Shipping, tops, Welder, Welding
Additional Information

ACHIEVEMENTS

*Placed 3rd in 2014 and 2015 SKILLS USA State Welding Competition
*Maintained 3.6 GPA at Grandview High School
*Honors and AP Classes

VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCE

*Food Bank of the Rockies
Interests / Activities
*Mechanical Engineering and Design
*3D Printing and all Computer-aided manufacturing processes

<JD_START>
Job Title: Project Engineer

Location: Buffalo, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Title 

Project Engineer

Location 

Buffalo, NY

About Us

From the precision-engineered reciprocating compressors to the robust large rotary and oil-free air compressors, Ingersoll Rand's esteemed line of products stands as a testament to excellence in manufacturing. Crafted with superior components, our compressors empower a myriad of clients spanning diverse industries to realize their business aspirations.

At Ingersoll Rand, our commitment extends far beyond delivering exceptional machinery. We stand shoulder-to-shoulder with our valued customers throughout their journey, offering comprehensive support from initial planning stages to seamless installation and diligent maintenance. Our global parts and service organization serves as a cornerstone, ensuring uninterrupted operations and unparalleled performance for our clientele worldwide.

Experience the reliability, precision, and unwavering support that Ingersoll Rand brings to our clients, as we pave the path towards success together.

Job Summary

We’re seeking a highly motivated Project Engineer (PE) who understands how to thrive and grow inside an interactive & dynamic team where safety, quality, creativity, and continuous improvement are paramount. Your background is proven in project management (mechanical projects), coupled with an outgoing personality and strong interpersonal communication skills.

In this pivotal role, drawing upon your wealth of product and business acumen acquired throughout your career, the Project Engineer is entrusted with the seamless execution of Ingersoll Rand MSG Centrifugal Orders. This role presents a unique opportunity for continuous improvement initiatives aimed at enhancing not only the team's performance but also the overall success of the business and personal professional growth.

The Project Engineer will help provide guidance to the Engineering Design teams, ensuring the successful completion of projects while maintaining adherence to project requirements throughout the lifecycle of customer orders and improvement projects. Collaborating closely with the Project Manager, Design teams, and cross-functional partners in Operations and Manufacturing, they will foster a culture of cross-functional success and unwavering customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities include actively participating in internal and external kick-off meetings, managing customer communications, and facilitating technical discussions with Design Engineering, customers, and suppliers to refine project scopes effectively.

As a key player, the Project Engineer will help to spearhead and execute projects aimed at enhancing our efficiency, effectiveness, and capabilities. Through these endeavors, we aim to solidify our position in the market and exceed the expectations of our valued customers.

Ideally bringing mechanical design engineering experience, you have the demonstrated capacity for self-direction and adeptness in leading technical discussions with both customers and internal teams. Your prior design experience will help equip you with the technical expertise required to articulate intricate details about compressor subsystems to inquisitive and discerning customers. Meanwhile, your business acumen will serve as a compass, navigating you towards decisions that align with the best interests of both Ingersoll Rand and our valued customers, ensuring an exceptional customer experience.

Responsibilities

Lead and guide the execution of several customer and improvement projects by tracking scope and schedule Lead and coordinate efforts of supporting engineering functions, e.g., Design Engineering, Manufacturing, and Quality Engineering. 

Basic Qualifications

Education: BS Degree in Mechanical Engineering preferred, other engineering disciplines considered. 3 years of mechanical design engineering experience preferred Conduct or participate in technical reviews of requirements, specifications, designs, code, and standards. Perform mental tasks such as critical decision making, organizing many topics, prioritizing work to align with business objectives, and exercising good judgment Demonstrate ability to cope with stress, change and pressure - while maintaining a pleasant and cooperative manner. Competency in industrial machinery, general project management, industrial equipment specifications, and documentation workflows. Basic familiarity with the major subsystems and parts of a compressor including the gearbox, lubrication system, intercoolers, controls, and accessories. The incumbent may be asked to give assistance in completing a proposal or communicate a topic involving this content to the customer. Excellent communication skills and the ability to develop working relationships with co-workers, suppliers, and customers are essential. SAP and Teamcenter knowledge are a plus. Relevant experience specific to compression industry is a plus 

Travel & Work Arrangements

Position works onsite Travel domestic and internationally up to 20% 

What we offer:

Ingersoll Rand offers a comprehensive benefits program that includes, but is not limited to:

401K (Matching up to 6%) Medical plans, Dental, Vision Vacation time, paid holidays and sick time Company provided short term and long term disability, life insurance and employee assistance programs Ingersoll Rand stock 

At Ingersoll Rand we foster inspired teams. As a powerful and progressive global industrial company, we are looking for talented candidates with a bias for action and an entrepreneurial spirit to join our team. Our employees are empowered to act as owners every day for our customers, our communities and themselves. We offer a broad range of opportunities to build a successful and rewarding career with an innovative company. Join us at the new and exciting Ingersoll Rand.

Ingersoll Rand Inc. (NYSE:IR), driven by an entrepreneurial spirit and ownership mindset, is dedicated to helping make life better for our employees, customers, and communities. Customers lean on us for our technology-driven excellence in mission-critical flow creation and industrial solutions across 40+ respected brands where our products and services excel in the most complex and harsh conditions. Our employees develop customers for life through their daily commitment to expertise, productivity, and efficiency. For more information, visit www.IRCO.com.

Ingersoll Rand is committed to achieving workforce diversity reflective of our communities. We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
